Legal_Issue: Erroneous finding of fact in a perverse or capricious manner, disregarding material evidence
Outcome: Refugee claim dismissed initially; decision set aside on judicial review
Credibility_Assessment: Questioned political affiliation, inconsistencies in testimony, implausibility of events
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Perceived inconsistencies and implausibility in claimant's narrative
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing, followed by judicial review
Decision_Maker: Refugee Division panel, then Federal Court judge
Application_Error: Exaggerated discrepancies, speculative findings, ignoring plausible explanations
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, remitted for reconsideration by a differently constituted panel
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness standard; unreasonableness due to capricious or perverse findings
Application_Factor: Credibility and plausibility of refugee claim
Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Refugee Division made unreasonable factual findings
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 96, jurisprudence on credibility and plausibility in refugee claims
Cause_of_Refusal: Doubt about political affiliation and implausibility of events
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of corroboration (implied)
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to properly consider explanations may indicate procedural unfairness
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging reasonableness of credibility assessment
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Procedural_Issue: Flawed reasoning process in administrative decision-making
Omission_Type: Failure to consider material evidence or plausible explanations
